resources.string: Kande is a heavenly place which is a centre point for all the travellers,hikers,nature lovers. Geographically located on the top of beautiful Himalayas and surrounded by the heart throbbing green hills, it is a place to visit. \n\n Kande is the place to start your trekking adventure through the dense forest , local villages where you will be heartily welcomed by the people and the beautiful nature itself. The approximate elevation of Kande is 1718m / 5636feet.

Kande is a must place to visit and discover the place more closely with the locals. During the winter season, this place is very much crowded with a lot of people from around nearby places for the picnic. Because of the beautiful landscape view, easy transport, good weather, and a spacious place to enjoy the picnic, people come here to enjoy. \n\n Kande is a hub for visitors to get to their destinations like Australia Base Camp, Tolks, Pothana, Dhampus, Panchase and many other popular places.

Kande is a place of multi culture races, ethnicity. Despite of having a diverse culture, people still have close harmony amongst them. Visitors can have good leisure time in and around Kande. 

 Buddhist Monastery 
 Kande Baraha Temple 
 Kande Picnic spots 
 Nepal Agricultural Research Centre 
 Panchase 
 Route to ABC 
 Community Schools

Getting to Kande is relatively easy and can be reached in around Thrity minutes of ride by motorbike or take taxi or public buses. Kande is just 30kms west of Pokhara. Since Kande is on high altitude, it gets colder when you reach Kande, so warm jackets or warmer is recommended. On the way to Kande, you can enjoy the beautiful sceenery of the nature. \n\n Have a Safe Journey

Kande is a beautiful place to visit and people here very friendly and welcoming. You can taste a variety of local food at the local eateries. Local dried meat known as Sukuti is a popular dish to eat. You can eat organic rice, chiceken, Ghee, lentils and traditionally distilled local spirit/alcohol known as Raksee.
